japanese:
さっきは驚きました。
実際にあるものなんですね。
translation:
That was surprising.
These things actually happen, huh?

japanese: ビックリさせちゃってごめんね。
translation: Sorry for freaking you out.

japanese: いえ、一花のせいではありませんよ。
translation: No, it's not your fault, Ichika.

japanese:
一花、五月？
なにかあったのか？
translation:
Ichika, Itsuki?
Did something happen?

japanese:
あれ、フータロー君。
ちゃんと私だってわかったんだ。
translation: Oh, Futaro-kun. You were able to recognize me.

japanese: は？　どういう意味だ？
translation: Huh? What do you mean?

japanese: ほら、いまの私、いつもと違うでしょ？
translation: Look. I look different from usual, right?

japanese:
あのなぁ、眼鏡をかけたくらいで
わからなくなるほど俺の目は節穴じゃないぞ。
translation:
I mean, come on, just because I wear glasses,
doesn't mean my eyesight is that bad.

japanese:
あはは！
冗談だって、そんなに拗ねた顔しないでよ。
translation:
Ahaha! Don't make such a pouty face,
it was just a joke.

japanese: ったく……。
translation: Jeez...

japanese:
しかし、なんで眼鏡なんてかけてんだ。
お前、目は悪くないだろ？
translation:
But, why are you wearing glasses?
You don't have bad eyesight, do you?

japanese: いえ、それが……。
translation: No, it's just that...

japanese:
五月ちゃんと噴水を眺めてたら、
子ども連れのお父さんに声をかけられちゃって。
中野　一花さんですよね、って。
translation:
While I was admiring the fountain with Itsuki-chan,
a father with his kids called out to me and said,
'You're Nakano Ichika-san, right?'

japanese: ああ、変装ってわけか。
translation: Ahh, so it's a disguise.

japanese:
案外気付かれないものだと思っていましたが、
やはり鋭い方もいらっしゃいますね。
translation:
I thought I wouldn't be noticed,
but there are sharp-eyed people after all.

japanese: あと、小さい子のほうがピンとくるのかも。
translation: Also, maybe little kids are more perceptive.

japanese: 小さい子？
translation: Little kids??

japanese:
お子さんが一花のファンだそうで、
サインをせがまれたんですよ。
translation:
It seems that the kid was a fan of Ichika
and asked for an autograph.

japanese:
あの子、メモ帳を握る手が緊張で震えていました。
その真剣さがとても可愛くて。
translation:
He was holding a memo pad and his hands were trembling
with nervousness.
It was adorable how serious he was.

japanese:
私も嬉しくて、書いてあげたかったんだけど
周りの人たちも集まってきちゃってさ。
translation:
I was happy too, and I wanted to sign an autograph,
but people around us started gathering.

japanese:
あれにはびっくりしました。
ともかく逃げるしかなくて……
あの子には申し訳ないことをしてしまいましたね。
translation:
I was surprised by that.
We had no choice but to run away...
I feel sorry for the child.

japanese:
うん。
握手だけでもしてあげられてよかった。
translation:
Yeah. It was good that I was able
to give him a handshake, at least.

japanese:
なあ、疑問なんだが、
眼鏡をかけるだけでも違うもんなのか？
translation:
Hey, I have a question.
Does just wearing glasses
make that much of a difference?

japanese: うん、意外に効果あるんだよ。
translation: Yeah, it surprisingly does.

japanese:
なるほど。
まったく、大女優様は大変だな？
translation: I see. It must be tough being a famous actress, huh?

japanese: まあね、もう慣れたものかな。
translation: Well, I guess, but I'm used to it by now.

japanese:
いつもこうでは、プライベートがありませんね。
一花も窮屈なのでは？
translation:
There's no privacy if I'm always like this.
Don't you feel a overwhelmed as well, Ichika?

japanese:
まあ、少しは。
でも女優は自分で選んだ道だし、覚悟はしてる。
translation:
Well, a bit. But being an actress
is a path I chose myself, and I'm prepared for it.

japanese:
それに、まだまだだよ。
もっとたくさんの人に私の演技を見て欲しいから。
translation:
And, there's still a long way to go.
I want more and more people to see my acting.

japanese:
無事に卒業もできたし、
ますます頑張っていかないとね！
translation:
Now that I've graduated,
I must work harder than ever!

japanese: へえ……。
translation: Wow...

japanese: ん？　どうしたの？
translation: Hm? What's wrong?

japanese: いや、お前も変わったなと思ったんだ。
translation: It's nothing, I was just thinking about how much you've also changed.

japanese:
えっ！？
な、なに、急に。
translation:
Huh?!
Wh-what is it, all of a sudden?

japanese:
前にも似たようなことがあっただろ？
お前が眼鏡をかけてて……。
translation:
Didn't something like that happen before,
when you were wearing glasses...

japanese:
あー……。
あったね、そんなことも。
translation:
Ahhh...
Yeah, something like that did happen.

japanese:
あの時は、恥ずかしいから言わないでー
とかなんとか叫んでただろ？
それに比べて、ずいぶん落ち着いてるな。
translation:
Back then, you screamed something like 'Don't tell
anyone because it's embarrassing,' didn't you?
Compared to that, you seem much calmer now.

japanese:
あれから１年近く経ってるんだよ？
私の意識も変わりますって。
translation:
It's been almost a year since then.
My perception has changed.

japanese: ……そうか。
translation: ...I see.

japanese:
悪かったな。
あの時もいまも、お前は立派な女優だ。
translation:
My bad.
You were a good actress then,
and you are still a good actress now, Ichika.

japanese: へへ、ありがと。
translation: Hehe, thanks.

japanese:
一花を取り巻く状況も、１年前とは変わりましたね。
すっかり人気者ですし。
translation:
The circumstances
have also changed over this past year, Ichika.
You've become quite popular now.

japanese:
ドラマ、ＣＭ、トーク番組にバラエティ番組……。
毎日のように出演していてチェックが大変です。
translation:
Dramas, commercials, talk shows, variety shows...
You're on TV almost every day.
It's hard to keep track of everything.

japanese:
えっ！？
全部チェックしてるの？
translation:
HUH?!
You're keeping track of everything?

japanese:
もちろんです！
ぜーんぶ保存してありますよ！
translation:
Of course!
I save all of them TOO!

japanese: 姉が好きすぎだろ。
translation: You love your big sister a little too much, eh.

japanese:
いいじゃないですか！
一花が輝いているシーンは
何度だって見返したいんです！
translation:
That's fine, isn't it?!
I want to watch the scenes where Ichika is in the spotlight, over and over again!

japanese:
あはは……。
まあ、私も妹好きすぎなところあるし？
お互い様かな。
translation:
Ahaha...
Well, I guess I love my little sister a bit
too much too. But I think the feeling is mutual.

japanese:
しかし、そこまで仕事が増えてるのに
この旅行の間、よく休めたな。
translation:
Nevertheless, you had so much work to do,
how were you able to take time off during this trip?

japanese:
社長が頑張って調整してくれたんだ。
仕事と学業を両立したご褒美って感じで。
translation:
My boss worked very hard to arrange everything for me.
As a reward for balancing both work and school.

japanese:
そのコレクション、興味あるな。
トーク番組に出てるのを今度見せてくれよ。
translation:
I'm interested in that collection.
Show me when she's on a talk show next time.

japanese:
いいですよ。
とっておきの場面を探しておくので
みんなで鑑賞会しましょうか。
translation:
Sure, I'll look for some good scenes
and we can all have a viewing party together.

japanese:
おや？
フータロー君、私の発言に興味がおありで？
translation:
Oh? Futaro-kun,
are you interested in my speeches?

japanese:
もちろんだ。
大女優様がテレビでどんなお馬鹿なことを
しゃべってるのか、たしかめてやろう！
translation:
Of course. I want to see what kind of idiotic things
the great actress Ichika talks about on TV!

japanese:
もー、ひどーい！
君なら言いそうだとはと思ってたけどさ！
translation:
Oh come on, you're so mean!
But I guess I expected nothing less from you!

japanese:
しかし、そこまで仕事が増えてるのに
この旅行の間、よく休めたな。
translation:
Nevertheless, you had so much work to do,
how were you able to take time off during this trip?

japanese:
社長が頑張って調整してくれたんだ。
仕事と学業を両立したご褒美って感じで。
translation:
My boss worked very hard to arrange everything for me.
As a reward for balancing both work and school.

japanese:
気持ちはわからなくもない。
どんな感じでやってるのか気になる。
translation:
I can understand how you feel, Itsuki.
I'm curious to know how Ichika performs.

japanese:
演技まで君に採点されちゃうの？
それはちょっとなー。
translation:
Are you going to score my acting too?
That's a bit much.

japanese:
そういう意味じゃない。
お前が夢に向かって頑張ってるところを
見たいんだよ。
translation:
That's not what I meant.
I just want to see you work hard towards your dreams.

japanese:
ええ……。
直球で返されると照れちゃうんだけどなぁ。
translation:
Yeah...
I get so shy when you say things like that to me directly.

japanese:
でも、ありがとね。
フータロー君。
translation: But, thank you, Futaro-kun.

japanese:
しかし、そこまで仕事が増えてるのに
この旅行の間、よく休めたな。
translation:
Nevertheless, you had so much work to do,
how were you able to take time off during this trip?

japanese:
社長が頑張って調整してくれたんだ。
仕事と学業を両立したご褒美って感じで。
translation:
My boss worked very hard to arrange everything for me.
As a reward for balancing both work and school.

japanese:
他にも、本当に色々と気を配ってくれたし、
恩返しのためにも頑張っていかないと。
translation:
Besides, he really took care of a lot of things for me,
so I have to work hard to repay him as well.

japanese: （へえ、あの社長もいいところがあるんだな……）
translation:
(Oh, so that boss
 has a good side to him too, huh...)
